title: List, Set & Map
subject: Java
theory:
The Big 3 Interfaces:
1.  **List**: Ordered, allows duplicates. (ArrayList = Dynamic Array).
2.  **Set**: Unordered, unique elements only. (HashSet = Hash Table).
3.  **Map**: Key-Value pairs. Unique Keys. (HashMap).

common_mistakes.correction: Causes ConcurrentModificationException. Use Iterator or removeIf.

interview_questions.question: Difference between ArrayList and LinkedList?
interview_questions.answer: ArrayList: Fast search (Index), Slow insert/delete (Shift). LinkedList: Slow search, Fast insert/delete.

real_world_use_cases.description: Map<Product, Integer> stores Product and Quantity.

summary: Choosing the right data structure dictates performance.
